    <h1 style="color: turquoise;"><marquee>WELCOME TO MY WEBSITE</marquee></h1>
    <h3 style="color: lightskyblue;">Here you will learn and have fun!.So grab your stationery and let's get to it.</h3>
     <h2 style="color: red;"><u><b>Html</b></u></h2>
     <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="100%">
     <centre><p style="color: lightskyblue;">The first topic we will be discussing about is Html.</p></centre>
  <p style="color: red;">What is Html?</p>
  <p style="color: turquoise;"><b>The HyperText Markup Language or HTML is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.</b></p>
  <p style="color: teal;">To learn more about html click the link below.</p>
  <nav>
    <a  style="color: turquoise;"  href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/">Html tutorial</a>
  </nav>
  <h2 style="color: red;"><u><b>Css</b></u></h2>
  <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="100%">
  <p style="color: lightskyblue;">We will discuss about css.</p>
  <p style="color: red;">What is Css?</p>
  <p style="color: turquoise;"><b>Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML or XML.</p></b>
 <p style="color: teal;">To learn more about html click the link below.</p>
  <nav>
    <a style="color: turquoise;" href="https://www.w3schools.com/css/">Css tutorial</a>
  </nav>
  <body bgcolor="darkblue"></body>
  <h2 style="color: red;"><u><b>JavaScript</b></u></h2>
  <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="100%">
  <p style="color: red;">I'm sure you have heard this somewhere but you don't know it but if you do this will be a breeze.</p>
  <h2 style="color: red;">Now what exactly is javascript?</h2>
  <p style="color: turquoise;"><b>JavaScript often abbreviated as JS,is a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and Css.</p></b>
  <h2 style="color: red;">What is the use of JavaScript?</h2>
  <p style="color: turquoise;"><b>To make web pages interactive.</p>
  <p style="color: lightskyblue;">Exactly,It allows developers to create dynamically updating content, use animations, pop-up menus, clickable buttons, control multimedia,etc.</p></b>
  <h3 style="color: lightskyblue;">This is a button I made using js</h3>
  <h2 style="color: turquoise;">My First JavaScript</h2>

<button style="color: turquoise;" type="button"
onclick="document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = Date()">
Click me to display Date and Time.</button>

<p style="color: turquoise;" id="demo"></p><br>

  <p style="color: teal;">To learn more about JavaScript click the link below.</p>
   <nav>
    <a  style="color: turquoise;"  href="https://www.w3schools.com/js/">JavaScript tutorial</a>
